issue.title: fix: envoy statistics config documentation

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: ok-to-test
labels.description: Set this label allow normal testing to take place for a PR not submitted by an Istio org member.

issue.body:
refer: https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/configuration/upstream/cluster_manager/cluster_stats

1. Istio uses `outlier_detection` for `circuit_breakers`
2. There are 6 retry metrics (`cluster.<name>.upstream_rq_retry*`) 
3. There are many upstream connections metrics (`cluster.<name>.upstream_cx_*`) 
4. Added `upstream_rq_timeout` suffixed example

And to help us figure out who should review this PR, please 
put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.

- [X] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

comment.body:
Hi @chinaran. Thanks for your PR.

I'm waiting for a [istio](https://github.com/orgs/istio/people) member to verify that this patch is reasonable to test. If it is, they should reply with `/ok-to-test` on its own line. Until that is done, I will not automatically test new commits in this PR, but the usual testing commands by org members will still work. Regular contributors should [join the org](https://github.com/orgs/istio/people) to skip this step.

Once the patch is verified, the new status will be reflected by the `ok-to-test` label.

I understand the commands that are listed [here](https://go.k8s.io/bot-commands?repo=istio%2Fistio.io).

<details>

Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available [here](https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md).  If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the [kubernetes/test-infra](https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/issues/new?title=Prow%20issue:) repository.
</details>

commits.message:
Update istio test reference (#12330)

* Update istio test reference

* Update to allow modifiers for gateway api

* go mod tidy after `make clean`
Update update_test_ref to also run gen target (#12332)

Updating InfraCloud in Pro_Services Providers (under Ecosystem) (#12327)

* Updating InfraCloud in Pro_Services Providers (under Ecosystem)

* content updation from third party POV

Update spire integration documentation (#12338)

Signed-off-by: Max Lambrecht <max.lambrecht@hpe.com>

Signed-off-by: Max Lambrecht <max.lambrecht@hpe.com>

Announce Istio 1.14 EOL on Dec. 27, 2022 (#12343)

Co-authored-by: Lei Tang <32078630+lei-tang@users.noreply.github.com>

Update Gardener docu (#12326)

Fix linting issues
./en/docs/setup/platform-setup/gardener/index.md:15: MD009 Trailing spaces
./en/docs/setup/platform-setup/gardener/index.md:72: MD009 Trailing spaces
Fix linter identified typos
19 | ternatively, [23 Technologies GmbH](https://23technologies.cloud
       19 | managed Gardener service that conviniently works with all supported clou
       19 | and comes with a free trial: [Okeanos](https://okeanos.dev/). Simil
       19 | ACKIT](https://stackit.de/), [B'Nerd](https://bnerd.com/), [MetalS
       19 | B'Nerd](https://bnerd.com/), [MetalStack](https://metalstack.cloud/),
       21 | log/2018/05/17/gardener/) on [kubernetes.io](https://kubernetes.io/blog).

resolve with recommendations from istio team

incorporate feedback from @ericvn and cleanup

issue.title: retry with exponential backoff when patch ends in conflict

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
When we moved from Istio Queue to k8s Queue in https://github.com/istio/istio/pull/35392, we lost the ability to retry with exponential backoff on conflicts added in https://github.com/istio/istio/pull/35243. So when the problem described there comes, we still end up bringing down etcd.

This PR adds in-place retry with backoff on conflict.

commits.message:
change log level dynamically (#242)

* add loglevel in adm command to dynamically get/set loglevels

* adapt Lazy init in tests

* code enhancement

* enhancement: avoid changing the set_logging() interface

* remove unsafe code

* modifications against comments

* refactor code to follow envoy's behavior

* clean code

* add funtionality to set specific mod's log level independently

* cargo clippy clean

* rebase: merge with #265

pull_request.title: change log level dynamically
pull_request.body:
mirror envoy's behavior: https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/operations/admin#post--logging
```
curl -X POST /logging To list the loggers
curl -X POST /logging?level={new_level} To change the logging level across all loggers
curl -X POST /logging?level={mod_name}={new_level} To change a particular logger’s level

NOTE: mutilple query parameters is not supported, for example
curl -X POST /logging?"tap=debug&router=debug"
```
below is test logs

- test case 1: if user try to HTTP GET the /logging, an indication will be returned

```
$ curl http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging
Invalid HTTP method

usage: POST /logging                                            (To list current level)
usage: POST /logging?level=<level>                              (To change global levels)
usage: POST /logging?level={mod1}:{level1},{mod2}:{level2}      (To change specific mods' logging level)

hint: loglevel: error|warn|info|debug|trace|off
hint: mod_name: the module name defined in the cargo.toml, i.e. ztunnel::proxy
```

- test case 2: user can get current log level by POST /logging
```
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging
current log level is INFO

$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging?
current log level is INFO
```

- test case 3: user cannot POST to a wrong URI
```
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/loggingsdf
$
```
- test case 4: user can change global log level by POST to /logging?level=debug
```
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging?level=debug
current log level is DEBUG
$
//debug log is visible now
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194770Z  WARN ztunnel::admin: testing warn
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194797Z  INFO ztunnel::admin: testing info
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194804Z ERROR ztunnel::admin: testing error
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194817Z DEBUG ztunnel::admin: testing debug
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194900Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::io: flushed 136 bytes
2022-12-10T06:05:09.039445Z  INFO ztunnel::xds::client: Starting initial ADS client
2022-12-10T06:05:09.045714Z  INFO ztunnel::xds::client: Starting stream
2022-12-10T06:05:09.046316Z  WARN ztunnel::xds::client: XDS client error: gRPC connection error (The request does not have valid authentication credentials): No such file or directory (os error 2), retrying in 15s
2022-12-10T06:05:20.573099Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::conn: read eof

//get the log level to double check
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging
current log level is DEBUG

//set to warn
$ curl  -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging -d "newlevel=warn"
current log level is WARN

//check the log, only logs equal and higher than warn is visiable
2022-12-10T06:08:31.966812Z  WARN ztunnel::admin: testing warn
2022-12-10T06:08:31.966827Z ERROR ztunnel::admin: testing error
2022-12-10T06:08:39.193123Z  WARN ztunnel::xds::client: XDS client error: gRPC connection error (The request does not have valid authentication credentials): No such file or directory (os error 2), retrying in 15s
2022-12-10T06:08:54.202463Z  WARN ztunnel::xds::client: XDS client error: gRPC connection error (The request does not have valid authentication credentials): No such file or directory (os error 2), retrying in 15s

//set to trace
$ curl  -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging -d "newlevel=trace"
current log level is TRACE

//trace log is visible now for all loggers
2022-12-10T06:10:58.386366Z  WARN ztunnel::admin: testing warn
2022-12-10T06:10:58.386444Z  INFO ztunnel::admin: testing info
2022-12-10T06:10:58.386480Z ERROR ztunnel::admin: testing error
2022-12-10T06:10:58.386537Z TRACE ztunnel::admin: testing trace
2022-12-10T06:10:58.386574Z DEBUG ztunnel::admin: testing debug
2022-12-10T06:10:58.386924Z TRACE encode_headers: hyper::proto::h1::role: Server::encode status=200, body=Some(Known(34)), req_method=Some(POST)
2022-12-10T06:10:58.387150Z TRACE hyper::proto::h1::io: buffer.queue self.len=102 buf.len=34
2022-12-10T06:10:58.387304Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::io: flushed 136 bytes
2022-12-10T06:10:58.387394Z TRACE hyper::proto::h1::conn: maybe_notify; read_from_io blocked
2022-12-10T06:10:58.387444Z TRACE hyper::proto::h1::conn: flushed({role=server}): State { reading: Init, writing: Init, keep_alive: Idle, allow_half_close: true }

```

- test case 5: change single mod's log level
```
zkf@pinn:~$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging
current log level is INFO
//set ztunnel::proxy to trace
zkf@pinn:~$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging?level=ztunnel::proxy=trace
//a new log level for "ZTUNNEL::PROXY" is created
current log level is ZTUNNEL::PROXY=TRACE,INFO

//other module's log is not affected
2022-12-10T06:15:02.098373Z  WARN ztunnel::admin: testing warn
2022-12-10T06:15:02.098454Z  INFO ztunnel::admin: testing info
2022-12-10T06:15:02.098490Z ERROR ztunnel::admin: testing error
2022-12-10T06:15:07.101640Z  INFO ztunnel::xds::client: Starting initial ADS client
2022-12-10T06:15:07.110615Z  INFO ztunnel::xds::client: Starting stream

//overwrite the same mod's level to warn
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging?level=ztunnel::proxy=warn
//the specific mod's log level is changed
current log level is ZTUNNEL::PROXY=WARN,INFO

//other module's log is not affected
2022-12-10T06:19:38.118658Z  WARN ztunnel::admin: testing warn
2022-12-10T06:19:38.118678Z  INFO ztunnel::admin: testing info
2022-12-10T06:19:38.118686Z ERROR ztunnel::admin: testing error
2022-12-10T06:19:52.370103Z  INFO ztunnel::xds::client: Starting initial ADS client
2022-12-10T06:19:52.392946Z  INFO ztunnel::xds::client: Starting stream
```
- test case 6: change multiple mods' log level
```
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging?level=ztunnel::xds=debug,hyper::proto=trace
current log level is ZTUNNEL::PROXY=WARN,ZTUNNEL::XDS=DEBUG,HYPER::PROTO=TRACE,INFO

//other mods are not affected, stay in INFO
2022-12-10T07:22:54.388074Z  WARN ztunnel::admin: testing warn
2022-12-10T07:22:54.388100Z  INFO ztunnel::admin: testing info
2022-12-10T07:22:54.388108Z ERROR ztunnel::admin: testing error
//hyper goes to TRACE
2022-12-10T07:22:54.388176Z TRACE encode_headers: hyper::proto::h1::role: Server::encode status=200, body=Some(Known(84)), req_method=Some(POST)
2022-12-10T07:22:54.388229Z TRACE hyper::proto::h1::io: buffer.queue self.len=102 buf.len=84
2022-12-10T07:22:54.388270Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::io: flushed 186 bytes
2022-12-10T07:22:54.388288Z TRACE hyper::proto::h1::conn: maybe_notify; read_from_io blocked

issue.title: change log level dynamically
issue.body:
mirror envoy's behavior: https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/operations/admin#post--logging
```
curl -X POST /logging To list the loggers
curl -X POST /logging?level={new_level} To change the logging level across all loggers
curl -X POST /logging?level={mod_name}={new_level} To change a particular logger’s level

NOTE: mutilple query parameters is not supported, for example
curl -X POST /logging?"tap=debug&router=debug"
```
below is test logs

- test case 1: if user try to HTTP GET the /logging, an indication will be returned

```

current log level is INFO
```

$

$

current log level is DEBUG

current log level is WARN

//check the log, only logs equal and higher than warn is visiable

issue.title: Ambient: add verification for daemonset status

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```


**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [x] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [x] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

issue.title: Ambient: add verification for daemonset status

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```


**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [x] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [x] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

issue.title: Ambient: add verification for daemonset status

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```


**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [x] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [x] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```


**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [x] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [x] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

issue.title: Ambient: add verification for daemonset status

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```


**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [x] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [x] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

issue.title: Ambient: add verification for daemonset status

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```


**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [x] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [x] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

issue.title: Ambient: add verification for daemonset status

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```

comment.body:
Hi @chinaran. Thanks for your PR.

I'm waiting for a [istio](https://github.com/orgs/istio/people) member to verify that this patch is reasonable to test. If it is, they should reply with `/ok-to-test` on its own line. Until that is done, I will not automatically test new commits in this PR, but the usual testing commands by org members will still work. Regular contributors should [join the org](https://github.com/orgs/istio/people) to skip this step.

Once the patch is verified, the new status will be reflected by the `ok-to-test` label.

I understand the commands that are listed [here](https://go.k8s.io/bot-commands?repo=istio%2Fistio.io).

<details>

Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available [here](https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md). commits.message:
Update istio test reference (#12330)

* Update istio test reference

* Update to allow modifiers for gateway api

* go mod tidy after `make clean`
Update update_test_ref to also run gen target (#12332)

Updating InfraCloud in Pro_Services Providers (under Ecosystem) (#12327)

* Updating InfraCloud in Pro_Services Providers (under Ecosystem)

* content updation from third party POV

Update spire integration documentation (#12338)

Signed-off-by: Max Lambrecht <max.lambrecht@hpe.com>

Signed-off-by: Max Lambrecht <max.lambrecht@hpe.com>

Announce Istio 1.14 EOL on Dec. 27, 2022 (#12343)

Co-authored-by: Lei Tang <32078630+lei-tang@users.noreply.github.com>

Update Gardener docu (#12326)

Fix linting issues
./en/docs/setup/platform-setup/gardener/index.md:15: MD009 Trailing spaces
./en/docs/setup/platform-setup/gardener/index.md:72: MD009 Trailing spaces
Fix linter identified typos
19 | ternatively, [23 Technologies GmbH](https://23technologies.cloud
       19 | managed Gardener service that conviniently works with all supported clou
       19 | and comes with a free trial: [Okeanos](https://okeanos.dev/). Simil
       19 | ACKIT](https://stackit.de/), [B'Nerd](https://bnerd.com/), [MetalS
       19 | B'Nerd](https://bnerd.com/), [MetalStack](https://metalstack.cloud/),
       21 | log/2018/05/17/gardener/) on [kubernetes.io](https://kubernetes.io/blog).

resolve with recommendations from istio team

incorporate feedback from @ericvn and cleanup

issue.title: retry with exponential backoff when patch ends in conflict

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
When we moved from Istio Queue to k8s Queue in https://github.com/istio/istio/pull/35392, we lost the ability to retry with exponential backoff on conflicts added in https://github.com/istio/istio/pull/35243. So when the problem described there comes, we still end up bringing down etcd.

This PR adds in-place retry with backoff on conflict.

commits.message:
change log level dynamically (#242)

* add loglevel in adm command to dynamically get/set loglevels

* adapt Lazy init in tests

* code enhancement

* enhancement: avoid changing the set_logging() interface

* remove unsafe code

* modifications against comments

* refactor code to follow envoy's behavior

* clean code

* add funtionality to set specific mod's log level independently

* cargo clippy clean

* rebase: merge with #265

pull_request.title: change log level dynamically
pull_request.body:
mirror envoy's behavior: https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/operations/admin#post--logging
```
curl -X POST /logging To list the loggers
curl -X POST /logging?level={new_level} To change the logging level across all loggers
curl -X POST /logging?level={mod_name}={new_level} To change a particular logger’s level

NOTE: mutilple query parameters is not supported, for example
curl -X POST /logging?"tap=debug&router=debug"
```
below is test logs

- test case 1: if user try to HTTP GET the /logging, an indication will be returned

```
$ curl http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging
Invalid HTTP method

usage: POST /logging                                            (To list current level)
usage: POST /logging?level=<level>                              (To change global levels)
usage: POST /logging?level={mod1}:{level1},{mod2}:{level2}      (To change specific mods' logging level)

hint: loglevel: error|warn|info|debug|trace|off
hint: mod_name: the module name defined in the cargo.toml, i.e. ztunnel::proxy
```

- test case 2: user can get current log level by POST /logging
```
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging
current log level is INFO

$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging?
current log level is INFO
```

- test case 3: user cannot POST to a wrong URI
```
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/loggingsdf
$
```
- test case 4: user can change global log level by POST to /logging?level=debug
```
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging?level=debug
current log level is DEBUG
$
//debug log is visible now
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194770Z  WARN ztunnel::admin: testing warn
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194797Z  INFO ztunnel::admin: testing info
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194804Z ERROR ztunnel::admin: testing error
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194817Z DEBUG ztunnel::admin: testing debug
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194900Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::io: flushed 136 bytes
2022-12-10T06:05:09.039445Z  INFO ztunnel::xds::client: Starting initial ADS client
2022-12-10T06:05:09.045714Z  INFO ztunnel::xds::client: Starting stream
2022-12-10T06:05:09.046316Z  WARN ztunnel::xds::client: XDS client error: gRPC connection error (The request does not have valid authentication credentials): No such file or directory (os error 2), retrying in 15s
2022-12-10T06:05:20.573099Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::conn: read eof

//get the log level to double check
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging
current log level is DEBUG

//set to warn
$ curl  -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging -d "newlevel=warn"
current log level is WARN

//check the log, only logs equal and higher than warn is visiable
2022-12-10T06:08:31.966812Z  WARN ztunnel::admin: testing warn
2022-12-10T06:08:31.966827Z ERROR ztunnel::admin: testing error
2022-12-10T06:08:39.193123Z  WARN ztunnel::xds::client: XDS client error: gRPC connection error (The request does not have valid authentication credentials): No such file or directory (os error 2), retrying in 15s
2022-12-10T06:08:54.202463Z  WARN ztunnel::xds::client: XDS client error: gRPC connection error (The request does not have valid authentication credentials): No such file or directory (os error 2), retrying in 15s

//set to trace
$ curl  -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging -d "newlevel=trace"
current log level is TRACE

//trace log is visible now for all loggers
2022-12-10T06:10:58.386366Z  WARN ztunnel::admin: testing warn
2022-12-10T06:10:58.386444Z  INFO ztunnel::admin: testing info
2022-12-10T06:10:58.386480Z ERROR ztunnel::admin: testing error
2022-12-10T06:10:58.386537Z TRACE ztunnel::admin: testing trace
2022-12-10T06:10:58.386574Z DEBUG ztunnel::admin: testing debug
2022-12-10T06:10:58.386924Z TRACE encode_headers: hyper::proto::h1::role: Server::encode status=200, body=Some(Known(34)), req_method=Some(POST)
2022-12-10T06:10:58.387150Z TRACE hyper::proto::h1::io: buffer.queue self.len=102 buf.len=34

issue.title: change log level dynamically
issue.body:
mirror envoy's behavior: https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/operations/admin#post--logging
```
curl -X POST /logging To list the loggers
curl -X POST /logging?level={new_level} To change the logging level across all loggers
curl -X POST /logging?level={mod_name}={new_level} To change a particular logger’s level

NOTE: mutilple query parameters is not supported, for example
curl -X POST /logging?"tap=debug&router=debug"
```
below is test logs

- test case 1: if user try to HTTP GET the /logging, an indication will be returned

hint: loglevel: error|warn|info|debug|trace|off
hint: mod_name: the module name defined in the cargo.toml, i.e. ztunnel::proxy

```

current log level is INFO

current log level is INFO

issue.title: Ambient: add verification for daemonset status

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.

```

issue.title: Ambient: add verification for daemonset status

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```


**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [x] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [x] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

issue.title: Ambient: add verification for daemonset status

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```


**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [x] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [x] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

issue.title: Ambient: add verification for daemonset status

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```


**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [x] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [x] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```

issue.body:
refer: https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/configuration/upstream/cluster_manager/cluster_stats

1. Istio uses `outlier_detection` for `circuit_breakers`
2. There are 6 retry metrics (`cluster.<name>.upstream_rq_retry*`) 
3. There are many upstream connections metrics (`cluster.<name>.upstream_cx_*`) 
4. Added `upstream_rq_timeout` suffixed example

comment.body:
Hi @chinaran. Thanks for your PR.

I'm waiting for a [istio](https://github.com/orgs/istio/people) member to verify that this patch is reasonable to test. If it is, they should reply with `/ok-to-test` on its own line. Until that is done, I will not automatically test new commits in this PR, but the usual testing commands by org members will still work. Regular contributors should [join the org](https://github.com/orgs/istio/people) to skip this step.

Once the patch is verified, the new status will be reflected by the `ok-to-test` label.

I understand the commands that are listed [here](https://go.k8s.io/bot-commands?repo=istio%2Fistio.io).

<details>

Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available [here](https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md). Update istio test reference (#12330)

* Update istio test reference

* Update to allow modifiers for gateway api

* go mod tidy after `make clean`
Update update_test_ref to also run gen target (#12332)

Updating InfraCloud in Pro_Services Providers (under Ecosystem) (#12327)

* Updating InfraCloud in Pro_Services Providers (under Ecosystem)

* content updation from third party POV

Update spire integration documentation (#12338)

Signed-off-by: Max Lambrecht <max.lambrecht@hpe.com>

Signed-off-by: Max Lambrecht <max.lambrecht@hpe.com>

Announce Istio 1.14 EOL on Dec. 27, 2022 (#12343)

Co-authored-by: Lei Tang <32078630+lei-tang@users.noreply.github.com>

Update Gardener docu (#12326)

Fix linting issues
./en/docs/setup/platform-setup/gardener/index.md:15: MD009 Trailing spaces
./en/docs/setup/platform-setup/gardener/index.md:72: MD009 Trailing spaces
Fix linter identified typos
19 | ternatively, [23 Technologies GmbH](https://23technologies.cloud
       19 | managed Gardener service that conviniently works with all supported clou
       19 | and comes with a free trial: [Okeanos](https://okeanos.dev/). Simil
       19 | ACKIT](https://stackit.de/), [B'Nerd](https://bnerd.com/), [MetalS
       19 | B'Nerd](https://bnerd.com/), [MetalStack](https://metalstack.cloud/),
       21 | log/2018/05/17/gardener/) on [kubernetes.io](https://kubernetes.io/blog).

resolve with recommendations from istio team

incorporate feedback from @ericvn and cleanup

issue.title: retry with exponential backoff when patch ends in conflict

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
When we moved from Istio Queue to k8s Queue in https://github.com/istio/istio/pull/35392, we lost the ability to retry with exponential backoff on conflicts added in https://github.com/istio/istio/pull/35243. So when the problem described there comes, we still end up bringing down etcd.

This PR adds in-place retry with backoff on conflict.

commits.message:
change log level dynamically (#242)

* add loglevel in adm command to dynamically get/set loglevels

* adapt Lazy init in tests

* code enhancement

* enhancement: avoid changing the set_logging() interface

* remove unsafe code

* modifications against comments

* refactor code to follow envoy's behavior

* clean code

* add funtionality to set specific mod's log level independently

* cargo clippy clean

* rebase: merge with #265

pull_request.title: change log level dynamically
pull_request.body:
mirror envoy's behavior: https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/operations/admin#post--logging
```
curl -X POST /logging To list the loggers
curl -X POST /logging?level={new_level} To change the logging level across all loggers
curl -X POST /logging?level={mod_name}={new_level} To change a particular logger’s level

NOTE: mutilple query parameters is not supported, for example
curl -X POST /logging?"tap=debug&router=debug"
```
below is test logs

- test case 1: if user try to HTTP GET the /logging, an indication will be returned

```
$ curl http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging
Invalid HTTP method

usage: POST /logging                                            (To list current level)
usage: POST /logging?level=<level>                              (To change global levels)
usage: POST /logging?level={mod1}:{level1},{mod2}:{level2}      (To change specific mods' logging level)

hint: loglevel: error|warn|info|debug|trace|off
hint: mod_name: the module name defined in the cargo.toml, i.e. ztunnel::proxy
```

- test case 2: user can get current log level by POST /logging
```
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging
current log level is INFO

$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging?
current log level is INFO
```

- test case 3: user cannot POST to a wrong URI
```
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/loggingsdf
$
```
- test case 4: user can change global log level by POST to /logging?level=debug
```
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging?level=debug
current log level is DEBUG
$
//debug log is visible now
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194770Z  WARN ztunnel::admin: testing warn
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194797Z  INFO ztunnel::admin: testing info
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194804Z ERROR ztunnel::admin: testing error
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194817Z DEBUG ztunnel::admin: testing debug
2022-12-10T06:05:01.194900Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::io: flushed 136 bytes
2022-12-10T06:05:09.039445Z  INFO ztunnel::xds::client: Starting initial ADS client

issue.title: change log level dynamically
issue.body:
mirror envoy's behavior: https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/operations/admin#post--logging
```
curl -X POST /logging To list the loggers
curl -X POST /logging?level={new_level} To change the logging level across all loggers
curl -X POST /logging?level={mod_name}={new_level} To change a particular logger’s level

NOTE: mutilple query parameters is not supported, for example
curl -X POST /logging?"tap=debug&router=debug"
```
below is test logs

- test case 1: if user try to HTTP GET the /logging, an indication will be returned

```
$ curl http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging
Invalid HTTP method

usage: POST /logging                                            (To list current level)
usage: POST /logging?level=<level>                              (To change global levels)
usage: POST /logging?level={mod1}:{level1},{mod2}:{level2}      (To change specific mods' logging level)

hint: loglevel: error|warn|info|debug|trace|off
hint: mod_name: the module name defined in the cargo.toml, i.e. ztunnel::proxy
```

- test case 2: user can get current log level by POST /logging
```
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging
current log level is INFO

$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/logging?
current log level is INFO
```

- test case 3: user cannot POST to a wrong URI
```
$ curl -X POST http://10.239.241.90:15021/loggingsdf
$
```
- test case 4: user can change global log level by POST to /logging?level=debug
```

current log level is DEBUG
$

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```

issue.title: Ambient: add verification for daemonset status

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```


**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [x] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [x] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```


**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [x] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [x] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

issue.title: Ambient: add verification for daemonset status

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Provide status verification for daemonsets like ztunnel and istio-cni.
Daemonsets are not custom resources, and should be checked separately.
Before:
```
✔ RoleBinding: istio-ingressgateway-sds.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Service: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-ingressgateway-service-account.istio-system checked successfully
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```
When failed:
```
✔ CustomResourceDefinition: udproutes.gateway.networking.k8s.io.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```


After this PR it will check daemonsets components like:
```
✔ DaemonSet: istio-cni-node.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✔ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ ServiceAccount: ztunnel.istio-system checked successfully
✔ HorizontalPodAutoscaler: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
✔ Deployment: istio-ingressgateway.istio-system checked successfully
...
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
✔ Istio is installed and verified successfully
```

When failed:
```
✔ ServiceAccount: istio-cni.istio-system checked successfully
✘ DaemonSet: ztunnel.istio-system: Istio installation failed, incomplete or does not match "generated from in cluster operator installed-state": waiting for daemonset "ztunnel" rollout to finish: 1 of 1 updated pods are unavailable
Checked 23 custom resource definitions
Checked 2 Istio Deployments
Checked 2 Istio Daemonsets
Error: Istio installation failed
```


**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [x] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [x] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.
